intro: Solanum itatiaiae, commonly known as Itatiaia nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. It features simple, alternate leaves and produces small, berry-like fruits that are usually green when immature. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
